interventions.Title: Identify Negative Thought Patterns
interventions.Description:
'- **Why it Helps**: It allows individuals to recognize and understand the unrealistic or harmful thoughts that contribute to their internet and social media use.
   - **What to Do**: Keep a thought diary to track the situations that lead to excessive use and the thoughts associated with them.
   - **Example**: If you find yourself scrolling late at night, note thoughts like "I need to stay updated" and challenge their validity.
interventions.extracted_value:
What situation led to excessive internet or social media use today?


What thoughts did you have during this situation?


Are these thoughts realistic? Why or why not?


What evidence do you have for these thoughts?


What alternative, more balanced perspective could you have on this situation?


How did these thoughts make you feel?


What actions can you take to avoid similar situations in the future?

interventions.Title: Challenge Cognitive Distortions
interventions.Description:
'- **Why it Helps**: It encourages the evaluation and restructuring of distorted thoughts, reducing anxiety or compulsive behavior.
   - **What to Do**: After identifying negative thoughts, question their truth and consider alternative interpretations.
   - **Example**: Counter the belief "I'm missing out" with "I can catch up later without missing important life moments."

interventions.Title: Develop Coping Strategies
interventions.Description:
'- **Why it Helps**: Equips individuals with tools to manage urges effectively and reduces dependency on social media for emotional regulation.
   - **What to Do**: List healthy activities (e.g., reading, exercise) to replace screen time.
   - **Example**: When feeling the urge to check social media, go for a 10-minute walk instead.
interventions.extracted_value:
What triggered the urge to check social media today?


What healthy activity did you replace screen time with today?


How did you feel after engaging in the healthy activity?


What challenges did you face in replacing screen time with a healthy activity?


How can you make this healthy activity a regular part of your routine?


What benefits did you experience from engaging in the healthy activity?


How can you apply this coping strategy to other areas of your life?


What additional strategies can you use to manage urges in the future?

interventions.Title: Implement Goal Setting
interventions.Description:
'- **Why it Helps**: Provides direction and motivation to change behavior, improving time management and limiting internet overuse.
   - **What to Do**: Set specific, achievable goals for reducing social media use.
   - **Example**: Aim to decrease social media usage by 30 minutes a day over a month.
interventions.extracted_value:
What is my ultimate goal for reducing social media use?


What specific actions can I take to achieve my ultimate goal?


What actions will I take each day to move closer to my goal?


How will I track my progress and stay motivated?


What potential barriers might I face, and how will I overcome them?

interventions.Title: Practice Mindfulness
interventions.Description:
'- **Why it Helps**: Enhances awareness of present activities and reduces automatic habits of checking devices.
   - **What to Do**: Practice mindfulness exercises focusing on being present without relying on gadgets.
   - **Example**: Allocate specific times to be device-free and focus on deep breathing or body scans.
interventions.Journal Template:
{
  "date": "",
  "time": "",
  "activity": "",
  "mindfulnessExercise": "",
  "deviceUsage": "",
  "thoughts": "",
  "feelings": "",
  "actions": "",
  "questions": [
    "What was the activity I was doing before I noticed my device usage?",
    "How did I feel when I realized I was checking my device?",
    "What mindfulness exercise did I practice today?",
    "Did I notice any improvements in my ability to stay present without relying on gadgets?",
    "What challenges did I face in practicing mindfulness today?"
  ]
}
interventions.extracted_value:
What was the activity I was doing before I noticed my device usage?
How did I feel when I realized I was checking my device?
What mindfulness exercise did I practice today?
Did I notice any improvements in my ability to stay present without relying on gadgets?
What challenges did I face in practicing mindfulness today?

interventions.Title: Behavioral Activation
interventions.Description:
'- **Why it Helps**: Encourages engagement in meaningful activities, reducing the tendency to use digital platforms as a time filler.
   - **What to Do**: Schedule pleasurable or productive activities throughout the week.
   - **Example**: Plan a weekly outing with friends rather than socializing solely through social media.
interventions.extracted_value:
What activities have I been avoiding due to lack of motivation or energy?


What are some pleasurable activities that I used to enjoy but have stopped doing?


How can I schedule these activities into my daily or weekly routine?


What potential roadblocks might I face when trying to engage in these activities, and how can I overcome them?


How will I measure the success of my behavioral activation plan?

interventions.Title: Set Boundaries with Technology
interventions.Description:
'- **Why it Helps**: Establishes a healthy relationship with technology and prevents it from interfering with daily functions.
   - **What to Do**: Define clear rules for when and how long you engage with devices.
   - **Example**: Turn off notifications after 8 PM to enhance relaxation time before sleep.
interventions.extracted_value:
Why is setting boundaries with technology important to me?


What are the specific times of the day when I feel most tempted to use my devices?


How long do I typically spend on my devices during each session?


What are some specific rules I can set for my device usage (e.g., no screens before bed, limited social media use during meals)?


How will I communicate these rules to others in my household?


What are some potential challenges I might face in sticking to these rules, and how will I overcome them?

interventions.Title: Use Self-Monitoring Techniques
interventions.Description:
'- **Why it Helps**: Increases self-awareness and accountability in behavior change efforts.
   - **What to Do**: Use apps that track screen time to visualize usage patterns.
   - **Example**: Review weekly reports and set new targets based on data insights.

interventions.Title: Cognitive Restructuring
interventions.Description:
'- **Why it Helps**: Altering negative beliefs that fuel compulsive usage can reduce anxiety and improve mood.
   - **What to Do**: Replace unhelpful thoughts with balanced, rational ones.
   - **Example**: Change "I must reply instantly" to "It's okay to respond later."
interventions.Journal Template:
{
  "Date": "",
  "Triggering Event": "",
  "Negative Thought": "",
  "Emotion": "",
  "Behavior": "",
  "Balanced Thought": "",
  "Rational Question 1": "Is this thought really true?",
  "Rational Question 2": "Is there another way to look at this situation?",
  "Rational Question 3": "How would I feel if I didn't believe this thought?"
}
interventions.extracted_value:
Is this thought really true?


Is there another way to look at this situation?


How would I feel if I didn't believe this thought?

interventions.Title: Engage in Problem-Solving
interventions.Description:
'- **Why it Helps**: Strengthens confidence and resourcefulness in managing social media-related challenges.
   - **What to Do**: Identify specific issues (e.g., cyberbullying) and brainstorm solutions.
   - **Example**: Develop a plan to address negative interactions, like blocking or reporting problematic users.

Using these CBT strategies, individuals can achieve a healthier balance with internet and social media use, enhancing both psychological well-being and quality of life.
interventions.extracted_value:
What specific social media-related challenges am I facing?


What are the negative impacts of these challenges on my mental health?


What are some potential solutions to address these challenges?


How can I implement these solutions in my daily life?


What are the potential benefits of addressing these challenges?
